request.description:
### Register User

This endpoint allows you to register a new user.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string) - The name of the user.
    
- `email` (string) - The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (string) - The password for the user's account.
    
- `password_confirmation` (string) - The confirmation of the password.
    

#### Response

- `status` (string) - The status of the registration process.
    
- `message` (string) - A message related to the registration process.
    
- `data`
    
    - `name` (string) - The name of the registered user.
        
    - `email` (string) - The email address of the registered user.
        
    - `created_at` (string) - The timestamp of when the user account was created.
        
    - `updated_at` (string) - The timestamp of when the user account was last updated.
        
    - `id` (string) - The tokenized identifier of the registered user.

response.name: TRANSACTION - FAILED DEPOSIT

request.description:
### Get Wallet Balance

This endpoint allows you to retrieve the current balance of the user's wallet.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `{{base_url}}/wallet/balance`
    

#### Response

The response will include the following fields:

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the response.
    
- `data` (object):
    
    - `wallet` (object):
        
        - `user_codec` (string): The user's unique ID codec.
            
        - `balance` (string): The current balance in the user's wallet.
            
        - `last_updated_at` (string): The timestamp indicating when the wallet balance was last updated.

### POST /wallet/airtime

This endpoint is used to initiate a request to top up airtime for a mobile phone.

#### Request Body

- `amount` (string) - The amount of airtime to be purchased, a minimum of 50 and a max of 5000.
    
- `phone_number` (string) - The phone number for which the airtime is to be purchased.
    
- `provider` (string) - The service provider for the airtime purchase.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `status` (string) - The status of the transaction.
    
- `message` (string) - A message related to the transaction status.
    
- `data` (object) - An object containing transaction details:
    
    - `transaction_id` (string) - The ID of the transaction.
        
    - `amount` (number) - The amount of airtime purchased.
        
    - `type` (string) - The type of transaction.
        
    - `status` (string) - The status of the transaction.
        
    - `description` (string) - Additional description related to the transaction.
        
    - `metadata` (object) - Additional metadata related to the transaction:
        
        - `service` (string) - The type of service.
            
        - `provider` (string) - The service provider.
            
        - `phone_number` (string) - The phone number for which the airtime was purchased.
            
    - `created_at` (string) - Timestamp of the transaction creation.
        
    - `updated_at` (string) - Timestamp of the transaction update.
        
    - `user_codec` (string) - Unique user related to the transaction.
        

#### Example Response

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "transaction_id": "",
    "amount": 0,
    "type": "",
    "status": "",
    "description": "",
    "metadata": {
      "service": "",
      "provider": "",
      "phone_number": ""
    },
    "created_at": "",
    "updated_at": "",
    "user_codec": ""
  }
}

 ```

### Get All Wallet Transactions

This endpoint retrieves all wallet transactions for the user.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the response.
    
- `data` (object): The container for the response data.
    
    - `user_codec` (string): The user codec information.
        
    - `transactions` (array): An array of transaction objects.
        
        - `id` (integer): The unique identifier for the transaction.
            
        - `transaction_id` (string): The transaction ID.
            
        - `amount` (string): The amount of the transaction.
            
        - `type` (string): The type of transaction.
            
        - `status` (string): The status of the transaction.
            
        - `description` (string): A description of the transaction.
            
        - `metadata` (object): Additional metadata for the transaction.
            
            - `service` (string): The service related to the transaction.
                
            - `provider` (string): The provider related to the transaction.
                
            - `phone_number` (string): The phone number related to the transaction.
                
        - `created_at` (string): The timestamp of when the transaction was created.
            
        - `updated_at` (string): The timestamp of when the transaction was last updated.
            

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "message": "",
    "data": {
        "user_codec": "",
        "transactions": [
            {
                "id": 0,
                "transaction_id": "",
                "amount": "",
                "type": "",
                "status": "",
                "description": "",
                "metadata": {
                    "service": "",
                    "provider": "",
                    "phone_number": ""
                },
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": ""
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
### Get Wallet Deposit Transactions

This endpoint retrieves the deposit transactions for the wallet.

#### Request Body

This is a GET request and does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

##### Response Body

The response will contain an array of deposit transactions with the following attributes:

- `id` (number): The ID of the transaction
    
- `transaction_id` (string): The unique identifier for the transaction
    
- `amount` (string): The amount of the deposit
    
- `type` (string): The type of transaction
    
- `status` (string): The status of the transaction
    
- `description` (string): A description of the transaction
    
- `created_at` (string): The timestamp of when the transaction was created
    
- `updated_at` (string): The timestamp of when the transaction was last updated

response.name: TRANSACTION - GET ALL DEPOSIT
